title: Luisa Zissman defends Photoshopping her kids’ pictures: ‘I want it to look nice’
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Luisa Zissman has defended Photoshopping pictures of her children, in a debate about school portraits.

The Apprentice star is mum to daughters Dixie, 9, Indigo, 3, and two-year-old Clementine, and has candidly opened up about altering photos of them.

During an appearance on Good Morning Britain, the 32-year-old was discussing the news that one school offered airbrushing for portraits.

‘I’ve never Photoshopped a school photo but we’ve had family ones done and I’ve just smoothed their skin, or if there’s a bit of ketchup…,’ she told hosts Susanna Reid and Adil Ray.

‘They’re not so lovely when they’re covered in crumbs of food. Two of them are ginger, so they have that fair skin that gets all red and blotchy, and I think it’s nice to look a bit smoother. And not look back and think, “Oh, my poor face!”

‘I would never Photoshop the freckles though.’

Defending her decision, the reality star admitted her kids don’t know she alters their pictures.

‘When it’s on the wall I like it to look nice, I’ve got a very nice house. I want them to fit the brand of the house,’ she joked.

‘They don’t know, they just think they’re beautiful always, Photoshop or not.

‘I wouldn’t Photoshop out a scar, or something like that because I wouldn’t want them to be ashamed of anything like that, but for me, there’s a line.

‘Anything that was permanent, I wouldn’t Photoshop. I wouldn’t make them thinner, I wouldn’t make their eyes bigger, I wouldn’t do anything like that… I don’t think I’d whiten their teeth.’

Luisa also explained that wouldn’t ever use an Instagram filter on any pictures of her daughters – as that is ‘worse’.

‘I don’t put my kids on social media either. I’m not one of those mums who has a filter on them which I think is worse,’ she continued.

‘I do think there’s a line to it, but for a school photo that you look back on, I think girls especially – and I’m really conscious raising three girls – sometimes a little ego boost, sometimes it’s okay not to like things about yourself.’

Advertisement

However, Dawn O’Porter – who is a mum to two boys with Chris O’Dowd– argued that her decision is ‘instilling a bad feeling’ in kids.

‘Bad school photos are a rite of passage, I love laughing about mine. They’re so cheesy, they’re so blotchy, they’re so terrible,’ the author explained.

‘I would just be worried about that future conversation of, “didn’t you think I was good enough? I was a child and you didn’t think I was cute.”

‘Let’s not instil that feeling.’

And viewers at home were divided over the debate, with many berating Luisa for her comments.

Flocking to Twitter, one fumed: ‘Right now on @GMB Photoshopping your kids school photos!!! I’m speechless, your children are beautiful, they’re your world.

‘No wonder there is no self-love with toxic damaged parents like that. What a sad world we live in #gmb.’

While another said: ‘Disgusting to even think about airbrushing your children!!!!’

However, more rushed to praise the star for being honest.

‘The honesty is real @TheLuluLife absolutely love her @gmb #gmb,’ a viewer posted.

‘Wish photoshopping was around when I was in school in secondary school not junior #GMB,’ a Twitter user posted.

‘@TheLuluLife raising 2 princesses myself I completely get everything you said on #GMB you came across really well and I totally got everything you said,’ a fan added.
